bands.documentation: An array of available bands where each object is a Band Object. If given, it requires at least one band

bbox.documentation: Bounding Box of the asset represented by this Item, formatted according to RFC 7946, section 5.

constellation.documentation: Name of the constellation to which the platform belongs.

created.documentation: Creation date and time of the corresponding data (see below), in UTC ISO 8601

datetime.description: The searchable date and time of the assets
datetime.documentation: `null` is used in EOPF context and so requires `start_datetime` and `end_datetime`

end_datetime.documentation: The last or end date and time for the Item, in UTC. It is formatted as date-time according to the ISO8601 specifications.

eo:cloud_cover number.documentation: Estimate of cloud cover as a percentage (0-100) of the entire scene

eo:snow_cover number.documentation: Estimate of snow and ice cover as a percentage (0-100) of the entire scene

eopf:image_size.documentation: Image size in pixels for the highest resolution data. Dictionary of image sizes, raster name used as key

eopf:resolutions.documentation: Dictionary of ground resolutions in m

eopf:timeline.documentation: Processing timeliness description (e.g. STC, NTC, NRT)

geometry.documentation: Defines the full footprint of the asset represented by this item, formatted according to RFC 7946, section 3.1. The footprint should be the default GeoJSON geometry, though additional geometries can be included. Coordinates are specified in Longitude/Latitude or Longitude/Latitude/Elevation based on WGS 84. Can be set to null if bounding box is sufficient to describe product location

gsd.documentation: Ground Sample Distance at the sensor, in meters (m), must be greater than 0.

history.documentation: complete history of the main steps that have been applied to the data after acquisition

instrument.documentation: Name of instrument or sensor used (lowercase, e.g. msi, sar, slstr, olci, synergy).

mission.documentation: Name of the mission for which data is collected (lowercase, e.g. sentinel-1, sentinel-2, sentinel-3)

platform.documentation: Unique name of the specific platform to which the instrument is attached. (lowercase, e.g. sentinel-3a)

processing:expression.documentation: An expression or processing chain that describes how the data has been processed

processing:facility.documentation: The name of the facility that produced the data. For example, `Copernicus S1 Core Ground Segment - DPA` for product of Sentinel-1 satellites

processing:level.documentation: The name commonly used to refer to the processing level to make it easier to search for product level across collections or items. The short name must be used (only `L`, not `Level`)

processing:lineage.documentation: Lineage Information provided as free text information about the how observations were processed or models that were used to create the resource being described

processing:software.documentation: A dictionary with name/version for key/value describing one or more softwares that produced the data

product:type.documentation: 9 upper case character string that identify type of product (e.g. S03OLCEFR) or 13 upper case character for auxiliaries (e.g. S02_ADF_DATAT)

sat:absolute_orbit.documentation: The absolute orbit number at the start of acquisition

sat:orbit_state.documentation: Ground track direction of acquisition start

sat:relative_orbit.documentation: The relative orbit number at the start of acquisition

start_datetime.documentation: The first or start date and time for the Item, in UTC. It is formatted as date-time according to the ISO8601 specifications.

updated.documentation: Date and time the corresponding data (see below) was updated last, in UTC ISO 8601

view:azimuth.documentation: Viewing azimuth angle. The angle measured from the sub-satellite point (point on the ground below the platform) between the scene center and true north. Measured clockwise from north in degrees (0-360)

view:incidence_angle.documentation: The incidence angle is the angle between the vertical (normal) to the intercepting surface and the line of sight back to the satellite at the scene center. Measured in degrees (0-90)

view:off_nadir.documentation: The angle from the sensor between nadir (straight down) and the scene center. Measured in degrees (0-90)

view:sun_azimuth.documentation: Sun azimuth angle. From the scene center point on the ground, this is the angle between truth north and the sun. Measured clockwise in degrees (0-360)

view:sun_elevation.documentation: Sun elevation angle. The angle from the tangent of the scene center point to the sun. Measured from the horizon in degrees (`-90`-`90`)
